dict.acceptation: ……制的；（人工）做成的，拼成的；虚构的；保证成功的；
使（make的过去式和过去分词）；

sent.orig: Is your overcoat made to order or ready made?
sent.trans: 你的外套是定做的还是买现成的？

sent.orig: Papermaking originated in China in the second century B.C. Paper made from linen in the early West Han Dynasty (206 B.C.-24 A.D.) was the world's earliest kind of paper made from plant fibres. By pooling the expertise of craftsmen in papermaking, Cai Lun of the East Han Dynasty (25 A. D.-220 A.D.) succeeded in producing quality paper from linen craps, rags, and used fish nets. Papermaking technology was introduced to the West in the third century.
sent.trans: 公元前2世纪我国发明纸。 而汉初造的麻纸是世界上现存最早的植物纤维纸。 东汉蔡伦集中了工匠们的造纸经验，用麻头、破布、旧鱼网作原料，监造出一批良纸。造纸术从3世纪起传到国外。

sent.orig: "Please, Sir, missis has made tea," said a female servant, bobbing into the room.
sent.trans: 一个女用人走进房来说，“先生，太太已经泡好了茶。”

sent.orig: "You've quite made my day by coming to see me, "said the old lady.
sent.trans: “你来看我，使我感到快活。”老太太说。

sent.orig: A boat must be made of buoyant material.
sent.trans: 船一定要用有浮力的材料来做。
